activities.loc: Courtroom D, Fourth Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Virgil Lee Tate Jr.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 13, 2022 at 08:45 am.

10:20 AM Defendant Virgil Lee Tate Jr. appeared by video, in custody at Dodge Correctional.  Attorney Ryan W O'Hara in court for Virgil Lee Tate Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Calendar call on October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
NOT DELIVERABLE AS ADDRESSED, UNABLE TO FORWARD, RETURN TO SENDER

Activity: Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:10 AM Defendant Virgil Lee Tate in court in custody by video at the Rock County Jail with attorney Ryan W O'Hara by video. Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived.  Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Bond to continue.

Activity: Preliminary hearing
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

2:32 PM Defendant Virgil Lee Tate in court in custody by video at the Rock County Jail with attorney Ryan W O'Hara by video. David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Michael Doran of the Beloit Police Department sworn testimony taken by video; Witness identified the defendant. Parties stipulate to felony conviction in case 19CF581. State moves for bind over, defense objects without argument. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information, bond to continue.  Arraignment scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Notice of Hearing for Preliminary Hearing on May 27, 2022 at 2:30 PM (Defendant Virgil Lee Tate Jr.)

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on May 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Activity:  Initial appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:14 PM Defendant Virgil Lee Tate in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Faun Michelle Moses by video on behalf of Ryan O'Hara.  Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address and date of birth verified. Court orders $500 Cash bond with conditions: Not to possess any weapons during pendency of case. Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 2:30 PM.
